Description: Small sandstone weight of irregular shape with several flattened parts at the outer surface that show that the object was probably used for several purposes as grinding/polishing. Around the middle a circumferential notch, probably to attach a string of some sort, this suggests a reuse as a weight. The notch has a width of 0.2-0.4 cm.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 134)
